ml.alternet.util

Class ByteCodeFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.util.ByteCodeFactory

  • @Util
public abstract class ByteCodeFactory
extends Object
    Generate the byte code of a class that implements an interface, but without methods implementation. This allow to get an instance of an interface.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteCodeFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getByteCode(String className, String interfaceName, String interfaceType)
      Create the byte code of a class that implements an interface.
      Class<?> getClass(Class<?> interFace)
      Create the concrete class of an interface : Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.newInstance(Foo.class); You are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
      <T> T getInstance(Class<T> interFace)
      Get the singleton instance of an interface : Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.getInstance(Foo.class); is similar to : public class FooImpl implements Foo { public static final Foo SINGLETON = new FooImpl(); } Foo foo = FooImpl.SINGLETON; except that you are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
      static ByteCodeFactory getInstance(String className)
      Get the byte code factory instance.
      String getParentClassName()
      By default the parent class is Object
      <T> T newInstance(Class<T> interFace)
      Create a new instance of an interface : Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.newInstance(Foo.class); is similar to : Foo foo = new Foo() {}; except that you are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
      String singletonName(String interfaceName)
      Return the name of the singleton for the generated class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteCodeFactory

        public ByteCodeFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public <T> T newInstance(Class<T> interFace)
                  throws InstantiationException,
                         IllegalAccessException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
        Create a new instance of an interface : 
        Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.newInstance(Foo.class);
        is similar to : 
        Foo foo = new Foo() {};
        except that you are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The return type, same as the interface.
        Parameters:
        interFace - The interface to which we want an instance. If it is not an interface, it should fail.
        Returns:
        An instance of this interface, without methods implementations. Its class name has the same name than the interface but ends with a "$"
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - When the bytecode failed.
        IllegalAccessException - When the bytecode failed.
        ClassNotFoundException - When the bytecode failed.

      • getInstance

        public <T> T getInstance(Class<T> interFace)
                  throws InstantiationException,
                         IllegalAccessException,
                         ClassNotFoundException,
                         IllegalArgumentException,
                         NoSuchFieldException,
                         SecurityException
        Get the singleton instance of an interface : 
        Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.getInstance(Foo.class);
        is similar to : 
        public class FooImpl implements Foo {
    public static final Foo SINGLETON = new FooImpl();
}
Foo foo = FooImpl.SINGLETON;
        except that you are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The interface type.
        Parameters:
        interFace - The interface to which we want an instance. If it is not an interface, it should fail ; that interface MUST NOT DEFINED the field "SINGLETON".
        Returns:
        An instance of this interface, without methods implementations. Its class name has the same name than the interface but ends with a "$"
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - When the bytecode failed.
        IllegalAccessException - When the bytecode failed.
        ClassNotFoundException - When the bytecode failed.
        IllegalArgumentException - When the bytecode failed.
        NoSuchFieldException - When the bytecode failed.
        SecurityException - When the bytecode failed.

      • getClass

        public Class<?> getClass(Class<?> interFace)
                  throws IllegalAccessException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
        Create the concrete class of an interface : 
        Foo foo = ByteCodeUtil.newInstance(Foo.class);
        You are not compelled to supply all the implementations of the interface.
        Parameters:
        interFace - The interface to which we want to generate a concrete implementation. If it is not an interface, it should fail.
        Returns:
        A concrete class of this interface, without methods implementations. Its name has the same name than the interface but ends with a "$"
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When the bytecode failed.
        ClassNotFoundException - When the bytecode failed.

      • getParentClassName

        public String getParentClassName()
        By default the parent class is Object
        Returns:
        "java/lang/Object"

      • singletonName

        public String singletonName(String interfaceName)
        Return the name of the singleton for the generated class.
        Parameters:
        interfaceName - The name of the interface, allow the singleton name to be derived from it.
        Returns:
        "SINGLETON"

      • getByteCode

        public byte[] getByteCode(String className,
                          String interfaceName,
                          String interfaceType)
        Create the byte code of a class that implements an interface. NOTE : the implementation of this method is generated at compile time.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to generate.
        interfaceName - The name of the interface, must exist as a Class.
        interfaceType - The interface type as in bytecode signature.
        Returns:
        The byte code of the class.
        See Also:
        ClassLoader

      • getInstance

        public static ByteCodeFactory getInstance(String className)
        Get the byte code factory instance.
        Parameters:
        className - The concrete class name of the byte code factory.
        Returns:
        A new instance.
